clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Early Home-based Cardiac Rehabilitation Program for Patients After Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Early Home-based Cardiac Rehabilitation Program for Patients After Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.source: Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the effect of this CR program on the improvement of myocardial function using the three-dimensional speckle tracking echocardiography (3D-STE) in AMI patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The effect of early short-term home-based cardiac rehabilitation (CR) program on left ventricular function in acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients is not clear yet.

primary_outcome.measure: myocardial function using the three-dimensional speckle tracking echocardiography (3D-STE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline strain parameters at four-week follow-up

arm_group.description: entailing an early home-based CR program
enter the usual care program, including the importance of carrying out physical activity, which was performed during inpatient care.

intervention.intervention_name: entailing an early home-based CR program
intervention.description: enter the early outpatient phase of CR program. The progressive exercise training of this phase was performed without supervision after their discharge. The CR program consisted of a five-minute warm-up period (stretching), a twenty-minute aerobic exercise (walking or trotting, gymnastics), and a five-minute cooling-down period (stretching)
enter the usual care program, including the importance of carrying out physical activity, which was performed during inpatient care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being aged 18-65 years with a confirmed AMI diagnosis
- Being suitable for the CR program
- Undergoing PCI at the entry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known ischemic heart disease, heart valvular lesions, intra-ventricular conduction disturbances, malignant arrhythmia, cardiac shock, and poor echocardiographic conditions to take STE examination
